name: help

args.name: func
args.doc: You can use help(functionName) to get info for the specified function.

doc:
Help for the available API functions

You can use help() to get list of available functions or help(functionName) to get info for the specified function.

name: clear
doc: clear console

name: deploy

args.name: params
args.type: { fee?: number, senderPublicKey?: string, script?: string }

doc: Compile currently selected contract and deploy it to default account

name: alias

fields.name: fee
fields.doc: Transaction fee. If not set, fee will be calculated automatically

fields.name: additionalFee
fields.doc:
If fee is not set, this value will be added to automatically calculated fee. E.x.:
Account is scripted and 400000 fee more is required.

fields.name: senderPublicKey
fields.doc:
If not set, public key will be derived from seed phrase. You should provide senderPublicKey in two cases:
1. Account, from which this tx should be sent, differs from tx signer. E.g., we have smart account that requires 2 signatures.
2. You to create tx without proof. Therefore no seed is provided.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.doc: Transaction timestamp. If not set current timestamp will be used. Date.now()

fields.name: chainId
fields.doc:
Network byte. Could be set as number or as char.
If set as char(string), charCodeAt(0) will be used. E.g.,
'W' will be converted to '87'
If not set, 87 will be used as default

fields.name: proofs
fields.doc: ITransaction signatures

fields.name: senderPublicKey
fields.doc: Account public key. This account will pay fee and this account's script will be executed if exists

fields.name: chainId
fields.doc:
Network byte.
E.g.,
87 is used for Waves mainnet, 84 for Waves testnet

fields.name: proofs
fields.doc: ITransaction signatures

fields.name: senderPublicKey
fields.doc: Account public key. This account will pay fee and this account's script will be executed if exists

fields.name: chainId
fields.doc:
Network byte.
E.g.,
87 is used for Waves mainnet, 84 for Waves testnet

doc:
Creates alias transaction or signs already formed one. Creates alias for address.
Alias could be used in place of address later

doc: Creates order or signs already formed one

name: transfer

fields.name: recipient
fields.doc:
Can be either address(base58 encoded 24 byte address) or alias.
Alias should be used like 'alias:{chainId}:{alias}>'. E.g.:
If we have alias 'foo', and we want TESTNET transaction, recipient should be 'alias:T:foo'

fields.name: feeAssetId
fields.doc: Fee can be paid in custom token if sponsorship has been set for this token

doc: Creates sponsorship transaction or signs already formed one

name: signTx
doc: Signs arbitrary transaction

name: waitForTx
doc:
Resolves when specified txId is mined into the block
By default has 20s timeout and uses current environment node

name: waitForTxWithNConfirmations
doc:
Resolves N blocks after specified txId is mined into the block
By default has 20s timeout and uses current environment node

name: waitNBlocks
doc:
Resolves N blocks after current blockchain height
By default has 20s timeout and uses current environment node

name: currentHeight
doc:
Current blockchain height
By default has 20s timeout and uses current environment node

name: waitForHeight
doc:
Resolves after target height has been reached
By default has 20s timeout and uses current environment node

name: balance
doc:
Get account effective balance
By default uses current environment address and node

name: assetBalance
doc:
Retrieve information about specific asset account balance
By default uses current environment address and node

name: balanceDetails
doc:
Retrieve full information about waves account balance. Effective, generating etc
By default uses current environment address and node

name: accountData
doc:
Get full account dictionary
By default uses current environment address and node

name: accountDataByKey
doc:
Get data from account dictionary by key
By default uses current environment address and node

name: stateChanges
doc:
Get invokeScript tx state changes
By default uses current environment address and node

name: broadcast
doc:
Sends transaction to waves node
By default uses current environment address and node

name: file
doc: Returns file content as string. Either from 'ride' folder or WEB IDE storage

name: contract
doc: Shorthand for file()

name: keyPair
doc:
Generates key pair from seed
By default uses current environment seed

name: publicKey
doc:
Generates public key from seed
By default uses current environment seed

name: privateKey
doc:
Generates private key from seed
By default uses current environment seed

name: address
doc:
Generates address
By default uses current environment seed and chainId

name: compile
doc: Returns base64 representations of compiled ride file

name: signBytes
doc:
Signs arbitrary bytes
By default uses current environment seed and chainId

name: setupAccounts
doc:
Generates test accounts with balances. Sends waves to generated accounts from master seed. Saves account seeds to global.env.accounts
E.g.: setupAccounts({foo:1000}). Now global.env.accounts['foo'] contains seed phrase for account and this account has
1000 wavelets
By default uses current environment node and seed as masterSeed
